children.comment:
Interface of an [AssetImporter]. An asset importer is responsible for
Initializing the [Asset.imported] field and importing an object
returned from a loader.
children.name: AssetImporter

children.comment: Must initialize imported field in [asset].
children.name: initialize

children.comment: Import [payload] and assign it to imported field in [asset].
children.name: import

children.comment: Delete [imported] object.
children.name: delete

children.comment: Everything in Dart is an [Object].
children.name: Object

children.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.
Returns a string representation of this object.
children.name: toString

children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existant method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[noSuchMethodError].
children.name: noSuchMethod

children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.
children.name: hashCode

children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.
children.name: runtimeType

children.comment:
Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.
children.name: Object

children.comment:
An abstract class for a disposable object.
You must implement [finalize]
children.name: Disposable

children.comment:
Pin the disposable object. See [dispose] for inverse.
Throws an exception if this object is already disposed.
children.name: pin

children.comment:
Disposes of the object. If nothing else has this object pinned,
the finalizer will be called. See [pin] for inverse. Throws
an exception if the object is already disposed.
children.name: dispose

children.comment: Clean up any object state here.
children.name: finalize

children.comment: This object has been disposed.
children.name: isDisposed

children.comment: Count of pins
children.name: pinCount

children.comment: Register the Spectre renderer with the asset_pack library.
children.name: registerSpectreRendererWithAssetManager

children.comment: Path to material asset.
children.name: materialPath

children.comment:
Spectre Renderer. The renderer holds global GPU resources such as
depth buffers, color buffers, and the canvas front buffer. A renderer
draws the world a layer at a time. A [Layer] can render all renderables or
do a full screen scene pass.
children.name: Renderer

children.comment: Clear render targets.
children.name: clear

children.comment: Path to mesh asset.
children.name: meshPath

children.comment: Path to material asset.
children.name: materialPath

children.comment: Link this texture. A texture must be linked before it can be used.
children.name: link

children.comment: Returns a JSON map describing this texture
children.name: toJson

children.comment: The asset path used when linking the texture
children.name: texturePath

children.comment: Construct a new texture
children.name: MaterialTexture

children.comment: Construct a clone of [other]
children.name: MaterialTexture.clone

children.comment: Update the constant value with [arg].
children.name: update

children.comment: Returns a JSON map describing this constant
children.name: toJson

children.comment: The constant value.
children.name: value

children.comment: The constant name. This is the same name used in GLSL.
children.name: name

children.comment: The constant type. This is the same type used in GLSL.
children.name: type

children.comment: Make a new material constant with [name] of [type].
children.name: MaterialConstant

children.comment: A material describes how a mesh is rendered.
children.name: Material

children.comment: Add a new constant with [name] of [type].
children.name: addConstant

children.comment: Add a new texture with [name].
children.name: addTexture

children.comment: Apply this material to be used for rendering
children.name: apply

children.comment: Key shader constant variable.
children.name: constants

children.comment: Key shader sampler variable.
children.name: textures

children.comment:
A layer describes one rendering pass.

A layer controls which render target is writes to.

A layer controls whether or not the depth and color buffers are cleared
before drawing and what value they should be cleared to.

A layer has a material. In the case of a fullscreen layer, the material
is the effect. In the case of a scene layer, the material is used as a
fallback material for renderables that do not have a material.
children.name: Layer

children.comment: Set the sort mode to be None, BackToFront, or FrontToBack.
children.name: sortMode=

children.comment: Current sort mode.
children.name: sortMode

children.comment: Name of layer.
children.name: name

children.comment: Material.
children.name: _material

children.comment: Force all renderables to rendered with the layer material?
children.name: forceLayerMaterial

children.comment: Render target.
children.name: renderTarget

children.comment: Should the color target be cleared before rendering?
children.name: clearColorTarget

children.comment: Red color target clear value.
children.name: clearColorR

children.comment: Green color target clear value.
children.name: clearColorG

children.comment: Blue color target clear value.
children.name: clearColorB

children.comment: Alpha color target clear value.
children.name: clearColorA

children.comment: Should the depth target be cleared before rendering?
children.name: clearDepthTarget

children.comment: Depth target clear value.
children.name: clearDepthValue

children.comment: Construct a new layer, specifying [name] and [type].
children.name: Layer
